Hi Paul,

A few information :

* J2EEUnit has stopped its existence at the end of 2000 ... It has 
been renamed Cactus, donated to the Apache Software Foundation and 
has begun a new existence there. It is now a fully functional unit 
testing framework for server side java code. URL: 
http://jakarta.apache.org/commons/cactus

* Cactus has chosen an in-container approach to unit testing, meaning 
that your unit tests (JUnit like) are executed within your servlet 
engine. The other approach, as mentionned by Robert is to use Mock 
Objects. To understand the in and out of In-Container vs Mock Objects 
I would suggest you read 
http://jakarta.apache.org/commons/cactus/mockobjects.html which is an 
unbiased (I think !) comparison of both approaches.

Have fun !
-Vincent Massol


--- In junit@y..., Paul Hodgetts <prh@z...> wrote:

> I was looking at, IIRC, J2EEUnit which seems to have mocks for the 
HTTP

very far
> with it at the time.  Easy Mock sounds cool, I'll have to take a 
look.
>

simulating
> HTTP sessions and responses?
>
